title: For Rent
description: A story about a rent-a-friend service in Tokyo

chapters.title: 渋谷の迷子犬とビラの山
chapters.description: Flyering job unexpectedly becomes a heartwarming lost puppy rescue mission.

sentences.レンタル田中、今日の任務はビラ配り。: Rental Tanaka's mission today is distributing flyers.
sentences.千円の時給で、人の視線を避けるプロになった気分だ。: For 1,000 yen an hour, I feel like I've become a professional at avoiding people's gaze.
sentences.皆、まるで幽霊でも見るかのように私を避ける。: Everyone avoids me as if I were a ghost.
sentences.退屈なノルマにうんざりしながら、足元に目をやった。: Feeling fed up with the dull quota, I glanced down at my feet.
sentences.茶色い毛玉が、小さく震えている。: A brown furball was trembling slightly.
sentences.こんな喧騒の中で、よくまあ生きているものだ。: It's amazing it's alive in such chaos.
sentences.私と一緒で、ここが居場所じゃないのに、ここにいる。: Just like me, it's here even though this isn't where it belongs.
sentences.手にはまだビラがずっしり。: The flyers in my hand still felt heavy.
sentences.しかし、このまま放っておくのも寝覚めが悪い。: But leaving it like this would weigh on my conscience.
sentences.結局、ため息一つ、ビラの束を脇に抱え、子犬を拾い上げた。: In the end, with a sigh, I tucked the bundle of flyers under my arm and picked up the puppy.
sentences.掌の上の小さな命。: A tiny life in my palm.
sentences.ポケットでスマホが震える。: My smartphone vibrates in my pocket.

chapters.title: 小さな命、大きな依頼
chapters.description: Puppy complicates new formal stand-in gig.

sentences.渋谷の雑踏を抜け、子犬を抱えながらスマホを覗く。: Pushing through the Shibuya crowds, I peered at my smartphone, a puppy cradled in my arms.
sentences.場所は都内の高級ホテル、ドレスコードは『フォーマル』。: The location was a luxury hotel in Tokyo, and the dress code was 'formal'.
sentences.私のいつものレンタル衣装じゃ無理だし、そもそも、この子が…。: My usual rented outfits wouldn't work for this, and then there's *him*...
sentences.抱きかかえた子犬が、クンクン鼻を鳴らし、私のTシャツの裾を甘噛みする。: The puppy in my arms whimpered softly and gently nipped the hem of my T-shirt.
sentences.さっきまでの大人しさはどこへやら、元気いっぱいの『営業妨害』だ。: Gone was the quiet demeanor it had just moments ago; it was now a lively 'business obstruction'.
sentences.「まさか犬同伴で披露宴に出るわけにもいかないしね。: I can't possibly attend a wedding reception with a dog, can I?
sentences.この小さな命をどうするか。: What to do with this small life?
sentences.依頼まであと3時間。: Only three hours until the assignment.
sentences.とりあえず、最寄りのペットホテルを検索する指が、妙に震えていた。: My finger, as I searched for the nearest pet hotel, was strangely trembling.

chapters.title: 迷子の足跡と不思議な縁
chapters.description: エミコ、風変わりな店で子犬の意外な解決策を見つける。

sentences.迫り来る３時間のタイムリミットに、エミコは焦っていた。: Emiko was frantic as the three-hour deadline loomed.
sentences.スマホで検索したペットホテルは、どこも「本日満室」か「予約必須」の表示ばかり。: Every pet hotel she searched for on her smartphone showed either "No Vacancy Today" or "Reservations Required."
sentences.抱きかかえた子犬は、時折小さな声で鳴き、エミコの焦燥感をさらに煽る。: The puppy she held in her arms occasionally whimpered, further fueling Emiko's growing anxiety.
sentences.渋谷の裏通りをさまよっていると、場末のスナックとコインランドリーの間に、奇妙な看: Wandering through the back streets of Shibuya, she spotted a strange sign nestled between a rundown snack bar and a laundromat.
sentences.「何でも相談所 兼 骨董品 兼 猫カフェ（仮）」と手書きされたそれは、まさしく多: Hand-written with "Anything Consultation Office & Antiques & Cat Cafe (Provisional)," it truly presented itself as a multi-purpose shop.
sentences.「あの…すみません」エミコが引き戸を開けると、中には埃っぽい骨董品と、気まぐれに: "Excuse me..." Emiko said as she slid open the door. Inside were dusty antiques and several cats whimsically strolling through the shop.
sentences.奥から現れたのは、色褪せたアロハシャツを着た白髪の男性だった。: From the back emerged a white-haired man wearing a faded Aloha shirt.
sentences.」店主はエミコが口を開く前に、子犬に目を向けた。: the proprietor said, looking at the puppy before Emiko could speak.
sentences.「仕事の間だけ預かってくれる所を探していて…」 すると店主はニヤリと笑った。: "I'm looking for a place that can look after it just while I'm at work..." The proprietor then grinned.
sentences.うちはペットホテルじゃないが、その子、しばらく見ててあげてもいいよ。: "We're not a pet hotel, but I can look after the little one for a while.
sentences.タダとはいかないが、面白いものがあるからね…」: It won't be free, but I have something interesting in mind..."
